content: In J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings," what is the name of the magical ring that grants its wearer invisibility?

In J.R.R. Tolkien's "The Lord of the Rings," the magical ring that grants its wearer invisibility is called the One Ring, also referred to as the Ruling Ring or the Great Ring. It was forged by the Dark Lord Sauron in the fires of Mount Doom in Mordor during the Second Age. The One Ring has the power to control the other Rings of Power and to render its bearer invisible, though this comes with a heavy price, as it also corrupts the user over time. The main plot of "The Lord of the Rings" revolves around the quest to destroy the One Ring and thus deprive Sauron of his power.
